entry.title: Paving brings delays to Oakland Bridge area
entry.summary: OAKLAND — Drivers can expect delays up to 20 minutes, starting Monday, in the area of the Oakland Bridge Project due to paving work.

entry.title: Winchester man arrested on 38 charges
entry.summary: Keegan James Spencer Cooper, of Winchester, is in Douglas County Jail on 38 charges for his alleged role in property theft, vehicle theft and other crimes.

entry.title: Eastwood students evict fish from hatchery, release into Deer Creek
entry.summary: Eastwood Elementary School released about 600 one-year-old steelhead into Deer Creek on Thursday morning. The students have been taking care of the fish throughout the year, maintaining their place as the nature school.

entry.title: Umpqua Oregon Hunters Association banquet scheduled for April 6

entry.title: Ask a master gardener: Attracting butterflies
entry.summary: Question: I want to plant a butterfly bush to attract butterflies to my yard, however, I’ve heard that Oregon classifies them as a weed. Is that true?

entry.title: Battle of the Badges: police and firefighters host blood drive competition
entry.summary: SUTHERLIN — Nancy Erickson has donated about eight gallons of blood in her lifetime. After years of on-and-off blood drive participation, she was back for another go at the Battle of the Badges blood drive on Thursday.

entry.title: Two Portland residents receive Oregon's top urban forestry honors along with City of Wilsonville (Photo)
entry.summary: PORTLAND, Ore. – The non-profit organization Oregon Community Trees (OCT) is honoring Portland residents Ryan Gilpin and Bruce Nelson and the City of Wilsonville for their work on behalf of urban trees. Gilpin and Nelson are receiving awards for their individual contributions to urban forestry, and Wilsonville is getting the award in the Organizations category. “Every year Oregon Community Trees recognizes individuals and organizations that are doing outstanding work to help our urban forests,” said OCT President Tyler Roth. “This year’s recipients’ are especially deserving for the depth and breadth of their commitment to educating people about urban trees and promoting policies and actions to keep those trees healthy and well cared for.” Gilpin, who lives in North Portland’s St. Johns nei…

entry.title: Roseburg library partners with restaurant to encourage youth reading
entry.summary: ROSEBURG — Local children age 4-12 are invited to participate in a reading program to earn free food from In-n-Out Burger. The Roseburg Public Library is partnering with the restaurant through April 13 to encourage kids to read more.
